info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 3:34PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT ABOVE 2000 FEET THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING THEN FOR ALL AREAS SATURDAY NIGHT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches, with locally higher amounts up to 30 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet, additional snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, elevations above 2000 feet including Fort Jones to Callahan, Sawyers Bar Road, Highway 3, higher portions of Highway 96 and mountains in Western Siskiyou County. For the Winter Weather Advisory, elevations between 1500 and 2000 feet, including Scott Bar and portions of Highway 96. These areas will see more significant snow late Saturday into Monday morning. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull is expected Saturday morning where new snow accumulations may be less than 3 inches, but a true break in fresh snowfall will be limited to being between showers. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
